page.title: 06TREETON INDUSTRIES
page.content: {Treeton Pit}was opened in{1882.}There are{two shafts}and {the deepest is {4,500 yards down.}There are{six seams} and the men are,{at present,}digging under{Swallow Wood.}The pit{covers 100 {acres}altogether. There are forty different jobs on the pit face and forty underground.{In 1985, 35 {apprentices have started work.}Of these, 15 are electricians and fitters and 20 are mining trainees. A{new {machine}is soon to be installed which will{cost Â£5,800,000.}With this,{no {wages need be paid}for the work. {Orgreave Works}established{1918,} covers an area of approximately{100 {acres,}and employs approximately{300 {workers. Products,}include Blast Furnace Coke, Industrial/Domestic Coke, and Gas for Industrial use. Approximately{300,000 tonnes}of coke is produced{each year.}
